meanings.definition: A rooster, especially in fairy tales.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the chanticleers woke up the farm with their loud crowing.
meanings.sent2: The chanticleers strutted around the barnyard, showing off their colorful feathers.
meanings.sent3: The chanticleers had a crowing contest to see who could wake up the sun first.
meanings.sent4: The chanticleers stood tall on the fence, their crowing echoing through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The chanticleers' crowing was so loud, it could be heard from miles away.

meanings.sent1: The chanticleers at the party couldn't stop talking about their accomplishments.
meanings.sent2: He was known as the chanticleers of the office, always bragging about his success.
meanings.sent3: The chanticleers claimed they could do anything better than anyone else.
meanings.sent4: She strutted around like a chanticleers, boasting about her achievements.
meanings.sent5: The chanticleers' boasting was so excessive, it became tiresome to listen to.
